column4: i am installing Ubuntu 6.06 on my friends PC and i have updated my own system just an hour ago, can i copy all those packages from var/apt/cache to his pc's folder and update his system as well ?
i am installing Ubuntu 6.06 on my friends PC and i have updated my own system just an hour ago, can i copy all those packages from var/apt/cache to his pc's folder and update his system as well ?
im sending you a script to backup/restore apt cache
it will overwrite apt config, so you restore the sources.list too
if it overwrites apt config. what will be the consequences
if it overwrites apt config what will happen ?
so i will just have to backup my sources.list
usually youd want to use the backuped(sp) one
i was just saying if you have customized sources.list the backup one will replace
are you writing the script yourself ?
i took it somewhere but used it many times
can you just outline your process so that i can manually do that ?
i execute the first line on the source computer. I transfer the apt.tgz to the other computer. i execute the second line on it. I apt-get update then upgrade
so basically it just copies all those new files and updates the system using apt-get dist-upgrade
no it's is just two commands.  you run the first one on the 1st comp and the second... just read the file.
thts what the script does, i am talking about what the script actually does
